settings.overlay_title: WELCOME TO THE FREE MY PAWS PSYCHIATRIC SERVICE ANIMAL / DOG TRAINING ACADEMY!
settings.overlay_text: We’re thrilled you’re considering the benefits of having a Psychiatric Service Animal (PSA). Typically PSAs are dogs thus our Free My Paws Certified Training Academy is geared to service dog training. We understand that having your furry companion by your side opens up so many opportunities and offers a sense of well-being and we are thrilled to be here for you.
settings.overlay_url_text_1: TRAIN YOUR FUTURE PSYCHIATRIC SERVICE ANIMAL TODAY

settings.text: If you're tired of struggling to find pet-friendly housing, being unable to take your service animal on airline flights, or facing extra charges when traveling with your PSA - look no further!  We're here to help you unlock the freedom to live and travel. Our Free My Paws Training Academy has been designed to meet the requirements of 300+ airlines, local establishment restrictions and landlord requirements around the world.

settings.title: WE HAVE YOUR PSA DOG TRAINING SOLUTION
settings.text: Learn how our Master Trainer, Toriano Sanzone has created two programs for Psychiatric Service Animal owners. As a result, we can assist you, regardless of your dog's current level of training, to ensure you have the legal protection and access you deserve.

settings.title: WELCOME TO YOUR ONE-STOP-SHOP FOR ALL THINGS RELATED TO PSYCHIATRIC SERVICE ANIMALS (PSA)
settings.sub_title: Let’s Cover Some of the Basics.
settings.text: What is a Psychiatric Service Animal Therapist Certified Letter and why do you need one? A Psychiatric Service Animal Therapist Certified Letter is a document that verifies your need for a Psychiatric Service Animal for either Housing and Travel needs. It's required by law in order to enter many local stores, fly in the cabin with your PSA or live in housing that prohibits dogs. Without either a Travel or a Housing letter, you risk being denied access to these benefits and even face legal consequences.

settings.image_title_top: HOW DOES OUR TRAINING AND THE CERTIFICATION PROCESS WORK?
settings.subtitle: Many aspiring Psychiatric Service Animal owners are seeking the benefits of a service animal or service dog but do not know where to start as often the information you find online can be confusing. In reality it is not all that complex.
settings.link_text: First you need to have a personal condition that qualifies you for a need, second your animal, typically dog, needs to be trained to both service that need as well as pass the
settings.text: Where owners often get tripped up is how to find a proper trainer and then a licensed therapist who can truly prescribe a mental wellness plan that would include both a legitimate travel and housing letter that can be safely used. Felicitails has created just the program for you that combines a Master Trainer with over 20 years of service animal training and a Licensed Therapist who has specialized in annual personalized therapy prescriptions that include both a certified travel and housing letter.

settings.image_title_top: If you’re looking to fly, travel, live hassle-free with a Psychiatric Service Dog, we are here to ensure that you are successful. We can assist in three ways:
settings.text:
1. If you need help training your dog to certify it as a service animal for housing and public access rights and compliance with DOT requirements for air travel.

2. If your dog's already trained & you need a trainer to confirm your dog is a service animal for housing, establishment access and compliance with dot requirements for air travel

3. My dog is already trained and my trainer can sign off on the dot form but i need therapist certified housing and travel letters

settings.title: If you need an expert to train your dog so it can be deemed a service animal for housing, establishment access and comply with DOT requirements for air travel
settings.text:
If your dog is not trained yet, you will want to enroll in our comprehensive Service Animal Training Program. This online course consists of 15 step-by-step modules, covering the training you need to transform your pet into a confident service animal. You will be assigned a personal trainer for weekly guidance, resolving sticking points and video review/support. The program typically lasts around two months. By the end of the program, your dog will meet the basic requirements for confirmation as a psychiatric service dog. This video series will establish basic mastery of the following to help you resolve any sticking points and provide personalized coaching and support:

• Your dog will allow a friendly stranger to approach it and speak to the handler in a natural, everyday situation
• Your dog will allow a friendly stranger to touch it while it is out with its handler
• Your dog will welcome being groomed and examined
• That you as, the handler, are in control of your dog when the dog is walking on a leash
• Your dog can move about politely in pedestrian traffic and is under control when on leash in public
• Your dog will respond to your cues to sit as well as lie down, then remain in place when signaled to do so
• Your dog will come when called or signaled by you
• Your dog behaves politely around other dogs
• Your dog is always confident when faced with common distracting situations
• Your dog can be left with a trusted person, if necessary, and will maintain training and good manners

Upon completion you will be provided a print-ready Free My Paws Canine Good Citizen Certification

Once you have completed your training and earned your certification, we will connect you with a licensed therapist who will work one-on-one with you to diagnose your physical, mental, and emotional support needs. After assessing your need for service support from your animal, you will receive a personal therapy plan along with two personalized letters, one for housing and one for travel requirements. These will meet all legal to secure your access to often limited housing; access restricted in-cabin airline travel; and enter into pet restricted spaces.Your Free My Paws Service Animal Training Certification and your Free My Paws Therapist Certified Travel Letter will satisfy the Department of Travel (DOT) in-cabin airline traveling requirements.

settings.title: If your dog's already trained & you need a trainer to confirm that it is a service animal for housing, establishment access and compliance with DOT requirements for air travel
settings.text:
If your dog is already trained, you will want to enroll in our Service Animal Training Review Program. In this program you will upload, through your Account Center on our website, a self-created video of your service animal for a comprehensive review by our Master Trainer.

The video must show that:

• Your dog will allow a friendly stranger to approach it and speak to the handler in a natural, everyday situation
• Your dog will allow a friendly stranger to touch it while it is out with its handler
• Your dog will welcome being groomed and examined
• That you as, the handler, are in control of your dog when the dog is walking on a leash
• Your dog can move about politely in pedestrian traffic and is under control when on leash in public
• Your dog will respond to your cues to sit as well as lie down, then remain in place when signaled to do so
• Your dog will come when called or signaled by you
• Your dog behaves politely around other dogs
• Your dog is always confident when faced with common distracting situations
• Your dog can be left with a trusted person, if necessary, and will maintain training and good manners

Our Master Dog Trainer will confirm that your animal fulfills the basic Psychiatric Service Dog (PSA) training requirements, or recommend further training. He will also provide all required contact information so you can complete your DOT form and for us to sign.

This process typically takes 24-48 hours to complete and upon confirmation, you will be awarded a Free My Paws Service Animal Training Certification.

Upon completion you will be provided a print-ready Free My Paws Canine Good Citizen Certification

Once you have completed your training and earned your certification, you will be connected with a licensed therapist who will work one-on-one with you to diagnose your physical, mental, and emotional support needs. After assessing your need for service support from your animal, you will receive a personal therapy plan along with two personalized letters, one for housing and one for travel. These will meet all legal requirements to secure your access to pet-restricted housing, access in-cabin airline travel and enter spaces where regular pets aren't allowed.

Your Free My Paws Service Animal Training Certification and your Free My Paws Therapist Certified Travel Letter will satisfy the Department of Travel (DOT) in-cabin airline traveling requirements.

Your comprehensive therapy plan will include a Free My Paws Certified Travel Letter & Housing Letter to satisfy service animal travel and housing establishment needs. Additionally you will receive a Digital Vault Access Card and Personalized ID Card for convenient paperwork access and identification.

settings.title: If your dog is already trained and your trainer can sign off on the DOT form but you need a therapist certified housing and travel letters
settings.text: You dog is already well-trained and responds to the basic commands required by the DOT? Already have a trainer who’s qualified to sign off on your DOT form?  Awesome!  In this case, simply order our Therapist Certified Housing and Travel Program to satisfy all of your Psychiatric Service Dog needs.

settings.title: WHAT ARE THE BENEFITS OF OUR THERAPIST CERTIFIED PSYCHIATRIC SERVICE ANIMAL PROGRAM?
settings.text: With our Therapist Certified Letters, for Travel or Housing, you'll have peace of mind. Knowing that you have the proper documentation side your PSA and have them by your side. This means you’ll be able to fly with them in the cabin, travel without worrying about them being denied access, and you can live in housing that otherwise wouldn't allow pets. Additionally, having a PSA can provide support and companionship, improve your physical abilities, mental health and overall well -being. As part of your prescribed therapy plan, Therapist Certified Letters provide optimum results.

settings.title: WHY CHOOSE US FOR YOUR THERAPIST CERTIFIED LETTER?
settings.text: Our Certified Therapists have years of experience working with individuals who qualify to live and travel with a Psychiatric Service Animal. We're dedicated to offering providing personalized therapy sessions, care and attention to every one of our patients. We ensure you receive the correct documentation that meets all legal requirements and accurately reflects your service animal needs. Plus, our easy online application process means you can get started right away and have your prescribed therapy plan in hand in no time.

settings.title: CERTIFY YOUR PSA WITH CONFIDENCE!
settings.text: Our Therapist Certified Letters for Psychiatric Service Animals, which includes dogs, are a must-have for everyone who wants to register and use their PSA with confidence and peace of mind. Don't risk being denied access to airline travel, facility access or accommodations - secure your prescribed treatment plan today and start living your best life with your fantastic furry friend by your side.

settings.title: HOW DOES THE CERTIFICATION PROCESS WORK?
settings.text: Our Certified Therapists will work with you to understand your physical, mental and emotional support needs. If they determine that you need a PSA to support your daily life, they will prescribe a treatment plan and provide you with two personalized Free My Paws letters, one for travel and one for housing, that meet all legal requirements.

settings.title: NO HASSLE ACCESS
settings.text: Access your favorite local establishments, even the grocery store, with no hassle.

settings.title: IN-CABIN FLIGHT
settings.text: Fly with your Service Animal in-cabin on all domestic flights.

settings.title: SAFE HOUSING
settings.text: Pass all Housing pre-screening applications for access to all rental housing you desire.

settings.title: ONCE TRAINED AND CERTIFIED, ENJOY THE BENEFITS
IT COULDN'T BE EASIER!
settings.paragraph: Your Psychiatric Service Dog will receive the proper training & review so you can be confident that you’re able to complete the dog trainer section of the DOT form.

settings.image_title_top: Meet your Master Trainer - Toriano Sanzone
settings.subtitle: Toriano Sanzone, head of our trainer’s team, is an internationally recognized Master Dog Trainer with over two decades of experience.
settings.text:
Born into a family of dog trainers, Toriano's passion began early. With a strong focus on positive reinforcement, Toriano has trained dogs for therapy, hunting, and security, as well as helping to rehabilitate countless 'problem' dogs so they can live happy lives within a loving human family.

Toriano's impressive professional experience includes working as a dog trainer in many settings.

In 2002, he founded the Sanzone School of Dog Training / Wolfkeeper University, which led him to write the highly-praised book "Dog Training w/ Love." 

In 2013, he trained directly under Cesar Milan at the world-renowned Dog Psychology Center in Santa Clarita, CA.

Toriano's international experience includes conducting private lessons and group classes, around the globe, in cities including Berlin, Mallorca, and Zurich. He is also a seasoned broadcaster and public speaker, having appeared on over 200 "The Wolfkeeper Show" podcasts.

Toriano is now heading up the Free My Paws trainer's team, to passing on his deep understanding of canine behavior and creating innovative training videos for PSA owners.

By helping PSA owners ensure their animal can meet DOT requirements, we’re making air travel easier and less stressful for them. More than that, we’re helping our clients make the bonds of love and respect they share with their service animals, even closer.

settings.title: Most domestic airlines require a completed DOT form prior to flying with your Psychiatric Service Dog (PSA).
settings.text:
Click HERE to access the DOT Service Animal Air Transportation Form.

If you’re looking to fly with your Psychiatric Service Dog, we are here to to help make it easy. We provide assistance in completing your DOT Service Animal Air Transportation Form prior to flying with your PSA, just email support@felicitails.com for assistance.

settings.ans:
This test demonstrates that the dog will allow a friendly stranger to approach it and speak to the handler in a natural, everyday situation.

HOW IT WORKS: The evaluator approaches the dog and handler and greets the handler in a friendly manner, ignoring the dog. The evaluator and handler do a pretend handshake (hands not touching) and exchange pleasantries. The dog must show no sign of resentment or shyness.

settings.que: Out for a walk (walking on a loose lead)
Sit and lay down on cue and stay in place

settings.title: DEPARTMENT OF TRAVEL (DOT) FORM COMPLIANCE
settings.title_text: Before flying with your support animal, the Department of Travel (DOT) requires you to show that your support animal is trained.  This means it must demonstrate, to a certified dog trainer, that it can pass a Canine Good Citizen Test. The required behavior and commands to pass such a test include:
settings.bottom_text: Click HERE to access the Department of Transportation Service Animal Final Rule which was last updated Wednesday, December 2, 2020
